ygData.subject: Re: That old Jig Myth... Call to Action
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I m gonna do that now since I don t have much else to do at the moment. =) EQ? Naw, taking a MUCH needed break after losing my level twice today and dying
ygData.messageBody:
>From: RON_TALBOT@...
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] That old Jig Myth... Call to Action
>Date: Mon, 11 Oct 1999 17:20:05 -0700
>
> Bummer. I ran into a Necro that had the same attitude. Not in the
> mood to argue I just played jig evey once and awile (when I was doing
> nothing else) to shut him up. (just the two of us and I could tell
>no
> amount of arguing whould change his mind)
>
> Perhaps you should have just run a test right then and there. Have a
> caster cast a spell, have someone else time it, med, Repeat with jig,
> med. This would have proved to your group what an idiot he was.
>
>
> The big problem is that seversl of the big web sites list the jig
>with
> this capability!!!! (EQstratics is one I think) We need to all
>contact
> these web sites and get them to correct this error. This would at
> least help the situation.
>
> Bujold
> 22 (!!)
> Xegony
>

I'm gonna do that now since I don't have much else to do at the moment. =)
EQ? Naw, taking a MUCH needed break after losing my level twice today and
dying a 3rd time while attempting to build an xp buffer. Lag deaths and
being trained by newbies while you're trying to kick your friend's ass in a
duel tends to be slightly frustrating. "Hey Sart, the duel was cut short due
to your untimely death.." =(

Sartori D'Elsiraad <The Companions>
Bard of Kelethin of the 48th Chorus (very borderline I might add)
Veeshan
